![Daegwallyeong Sky Ranch (대관령 하늘목장)](/2022-07-25-1658781380182/2037172_image2_1.webp) ## Overview > Daegwallyeong Sky Ranch, established in 1974, is located on a 100 million ㎡ plot of land in the highlands of Daegwallyeong Pass. The ranch opened to the public as a tourist attraction in 2014. The environmentally friendly ranch raises over 400 cows, 100 sheep and 40 horses. Visitors can easily view the ranch by riding a tractor over the 5-kilometer-long course. The view of the ranch and surrounding area is best seen from the sky deck observatory, located at 1,000 meters above sea level. The ranch also features four themed walking paths. Available activities include horseback riding, and feeding baby animals. ## Intro | | | | - | - | |accomcount:|N/A| |expagerange:|Open to visitors of all ages
* Horseback riding open to visitors ages 6 and older| |infocenter:|• 1330 Travel Hotline: +82-2-1330
(Korean, English, Japanese, Chinese)
• For more info: +82-33-322-8061| |opendate:|2014| |parking:|Available (Sedans 100 spaces / Large vehicles 20 spaces)| |restdate:|N/A (Open all year round)| |usetime:|October-March 09:00-17:30
April-September 09:00-18:00| ## Detail Info | | | | - | - | |Film Locations:|Drama "Lovestruck in the City (2020)"
Variety program "Running Man," "2 Days & 1 Night," "I Live Alone"| |Admission Fees:|Adults 7,000 won / Children 5,000 won| |Available Facilities:|Sheep ranch, horse ranch, cafe, store, rest area| |Facility Utilization Fees:|Tractor ride - Adults 7,000 won / Children 6,000 won
Horseback riding - 10,000 won
Feeding experience - 2,000 won| |Restrooms:|Available| |Parking Fees:|Free| |Interpretation Services Offered:|Not available| ## Detail Image ![/2022-07-25-1658781380182/1946993_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658781380182/1946993_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658781380182/1946994_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658781380182/1946994_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658781380182/1946995_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658781380182/1946995_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658781380182/1946998_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658781380182/1946998_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658781380182/1947001_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658781380182/1947001_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658781380182/2037173_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658781380182/2037173_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658781380182/2037174_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658781380182/2037174_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658781380182/2037175_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658781380182/2037175_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658781380182/2037176_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658781380182/2037176_image2_1.webp) ## Contact - [☎️+82-33-322-8061](tel:+82333228061) - [🏠skyranch.co.kr](http://skyranch.co.kr/) ```googleMap latitude: 37.7071731576 longitude: 128.7188396792 title: 458-23, Kkotbadyangji-gil, Pyeongchang-gun, Gangwon-do ``` ## Directions [Taxi]
Approx. 30 min from Jinbu (Odaesan) Station

data.title: Daegwallyeong Sky Ranch (대관령 하늘목장)
data.description: Daegwallyeong Sky Ranch, established in 1974, is located on a 100 million ㎡ plot of land in the highlands of Daegwallyeong Pass. The ranch opened to the public as a tourist attraction in 2014. The environmentally friendly ranch raises over 400 cows, 100 sheep and 40 horses. Visitors can easily view the ranch by riding a tractor over the 5-kilometer-long course. The view of the ranch and surrounding area is best seen from the sky deck observatory, located at 1,000 meters above sea level. The ranch also features four themed walking paths. Available activities include horseback riding, and feeding baby animals.
data.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Memorial Tower of Baengmagoji Battlefield and Memorial Museum (백마고지 위령비와 기념관)
dataList.description:
Located in the northern area of South Korea, Baengmagoji Battlefield was one of the bloodiest battlefields during the Korean War. The communist Chinese army launched a major offensive attack for 10 days on October 6, 1952 during the Battle of Baengmagoji, which can be translated into the Battle of White Horse Highlands. Due to this battle, the communist Chinese army suffered around 14,000 casualties and the army completely collapsed while the 9th Infantry Division won the Battle of Baengmagoji and got the nickname “White Horse.”

After the battle, the area gave off a bad smell because of the dead bodies. The mountain area lost its original shape due to the severe battle and as a result the area was named “Baengmagoji” as it was said to resemble a white horse (baengma) lying down.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Manhae Village (만해마을)
dataList.description: Manhae Village was established as a training center and memorial hall for national activist Monk Manhae Han Yongun, revered for his literary and philosophical inspiration, as well as his devotion to the nation and Korean people during the Democracy Movement.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Mangyeongdae Pavilion (만경대)
dataList.description: Mangyeongdae Pavilion, located on the shore of the East Coast, one-kilometer east of Donghae City Hall, was built in 1613 while old Joseon was under the rule of King Gwanghaegun. However, the pavilion was destroyed by rainstorms and later rebuilt by the Samcheok Kim family some 60 years ago. While offering a spectacular view of sea to the east, the pavilion also offers a refreshing view of expansive pine forests to the north. If you look to the west, you will enjoy a magnificent view of Dutasan Mountain beyond the pavilion’s back lawn as well as the Jeoncheon Stream flowing into the East Sea alongside a steep cliff-wall. As only Jukseoru Pavilion of Samcheok matched its view, poets of former times are said to have frequented Mangyeongdae Pavilion.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Mangsang Beach (망상해변)
dataList.description: Mangsang Beach is sought out by many families and tourists for its beautiful white sand, lush pine forest, shallow waters, and location in a neighborhood full of convenient facilities. Mangsang Beach is located 3 kilometers north from Mukho Port and it represents the east coast, along with Okgye and Gyeongpo Beaches.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Lohas Park & Wacapuca (로하스파크&와카푸카)
dataList.description: Lohas Garden & WacaPuca is an eco-themed park located 700 meters above sea level in the highlands of Pyeongchang, Gangwon-do Province. Sitting in the most beautiful national forest of Phyeongchang (Total area 3,305,785㎡ Structural area 396,694㎡), Lohas Garden offers the most natural scenic views in Korea.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Lee Hyo-seok Culture Village (이효석문화마을)
dataList.description:
Lee Hyo-seok Culture Village is the place where the author Lee Hyo-seok (pen name “Gasan”) was born and raised. The village is also the setting of the author’s novel When the Buckwheat Blossoms,” one of the most celebrated Korean short stories to date.

In 1990, the village place was designated ‘first national cultural village’ by the Ministry of Culture and Tourism. The village is comprised of the authors birth house, a water mill, Gasan Park, Lee Hyo-seok Memorial Hall, and a buckwheat museum. During the peak of the blossoming season in early fall, the annual Lee Hyo-seok Cultural Festival takes place and visitors can enjoy the beautiful scenery of snow-white fields of buckwheat flowers.

Lee Hyo-seok Cultural Festival commemorates the modern Korean writer and features buckwheat-themed programs. Events include a Hyo-seok essay contest, traditional performances, a costume parade, a photo contest, and When the Buckwheat Blossoms plays and related performances. During the festival, visitors can enjoy makguksu (buckwheat noodles) and memil buchim (buckwheat pancakes) and tour the locations that appear in the famous short story.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Korean Peninsula-shaped Cliffs-Gangwon Paleozoic Geopark (한반도지형-강원고생대 국가지질공원)
dataList.description: Seonam Village is a small town located on the banks of the Seogang River in Yeongwol, Gangwon-do. The village is famous for its land formation that is shaped like the Korean peninsula, due to the river meandering around the village forming an outline in the shape of the peninsula. In the summer, many people come to enjoy rafting from the East Coast to the West Coast of the peninsula-like cliff formation, with Homigot in the south and Baekdusan Mountain in the North.
dataList.author: korea-tour
